intro: Seseli dioicum, commonly known as narrowleaf seseli, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinctive, hairy texture. Seseli dioicum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
